desc: Students investigate contemporary approaches to classical issues in metaphysics, which include the mind-body problem; personal identity and immortality; space and time; causality; and realism, anti-realism, and truth. Specific issues discussed vary from year to year. May be repeated if topics are different. Prerequisites: two courses in philosophy, one of which must be either 235 or 236 or permission of the department chair. Offered in 2011-12 and alternate years.
name: Sem: Metaphysics
notes: Prerequisites: Two courses in Philosophy, one of which must be either Phil 235 or 236.
